summary: The memorandum from the AMBRUSH Organization covers activities and findings from April 1961 to January 1962, focusing on the Revolutionary Council Anti-Castro Security and Counter-Intelligence Team. It details concerns over Cuban Communist penetration in the U.S. Government, suspicions regarding Castro's G-2 operations utilizing women for clandestine activities, and the involvement of individuals like Eugenio Martinez in Watergate, with his past ties to JMWAVE Station. The document also outlines intelligence gathering and financial support efforts for anti-Castro operations, alongside worries about Castro's infiltration into the Frente (FRD - Revolutionary Democratic Front) and U.S. activities.
key_findings: Document mentions Cuban Communist penetration agents in all branches of importance of the U.S. Government.
Suspicions of Castro's G-2 operations using women for clandestine activities in the U.S.
Eugenio Martinez's involvement in Watergate and past association with JMWAVE Station highlighted.
Efforts to gather intelligence and financial support for anti-Castro operations detailed.
Concerns over Castro's penetration into the Frente (FRD - Revolutionary Democratic Front) and U.S. activities.
